detection of capture gamma-rays. Detector consists
of 42 hexagonal and pentagonal crystals forming a
spherical shell of Ba-F2 with 10 cm inner radius
and 15 cm thickness. Resolution of energy is 7%
at 2.5 MeV, time resolution 500 picosec, peak
efficiency 90% at 1 MeV. The 1.8 MeV gamma-ray
threshold in sum energy used in the present
experiment corresponds to an efficiency for capture

.The samples were prepared from isotopically enriched
hafnium oxide powder Hf-O2. The powder was pressed
into pellets 15-mm in diameter. After cooling, the
pellets were enclosed in aluminum  cans with 0.2 mm
thick walls. In addition to the five hafnium samples,
identical cans have been used for preparing the gold
sample for measuring the neutron flux, an empty sample
for determining the sample-independent background and
graphite sample for simulating the background because

The neutron energy range from thermal to 700-keV was
divided into three intervals-I(X). The dominant part
between 3 and 225-keV (I2) is provided by the present
experiments. These data were obtained with sufficient
resolution in neutron energy to exclude systematic
uncertainties in the calculation of the Maxwellian
